text:
63 yo male w/ 5+ week hx of worsening, ascending R sided neurological
   deficits including facial droop, R arm hemiparesis, L leg weakness, + R
   sided pronator drift.  Speech intact, a+ox3.   Pt also w/ c/o
   significant back pain, worsening in last week.  Pt went to several OSH
   for treatment, eventually being transferred from [**Hospital 3934**] Hosp for stroke
   r/o.   other incidental findings: partial LLL collapse, +atelectasis.
   Lyme disease
   Assessment:
   See neuro deficits above, +lyme titer reported from PCP
[**Name Initial (PRE) **] office.
   Repeat titer pending here.  Pt being r/o for several other infectious
   processes at this time, including viral vs bacterial vs fungal
   meningitis.
   Action:
   CSF cx pending, (prelim gram stain +WBCs), airborne resp precautions
   upgraded to droplet prec d/t very low likelihood of TB.  Ceftriaxone to
   cover lyme dx, multi empiric abx coverage continued.  MRI completed
   yesterday, being read further by radiology and neuro.
   Response:
   Remains afebrile, neuro exam stable. Per son, overall R sided arm
   appears weaker than in last 48hrs, though exam unchanged acutely today
   [**Name6 (MD) 24**] this RN
s assessment.  Perrla, a+ox3, speech clear, swallow, gag,
   cough intact.
   Plan:
   Await all pending cx and serologies, follow temps, neuro exam, white
   count daily.  Await final read of MRI.
   Dyspnea (Shortness of breath)
   Assessment:
   Extubated this am w/out difficulty, o2 sats mid 90s on 50% face tent
   o2.  over day, breathing effort worsening, o2 sats dropping to low-mid
   80s on room air, sats stable on o2.  LS very diminished, intermittent
   wheezing noted to upper fields.
   Action:
   Fio2 increased, freq pulm toileting, cough/deep breathing, OOB to chair
   x1 w/ assist.  Chest PT intermittently, adeq pain control w/ prn meds,
   prn nebs for wheezing.  CXR this evening.
   Response:
   Breathing pattern not improving over day, in fact worsening, slightly
   more tachypneic this pm, to high 20s at times.  f/u CXR shows signif
   worsened LLL collapse.  LS remain diminished, although wheezing
   improved.  O2 sats at best mid 90s on 100% face tent o2.
   Plan:
   Continue pulm toileting, oral care routinely.  Plan for mask bipap this
   evening if pt will tolerate.  100% fio2 supplemented in meantime.
   Acute Pain
   Assessment:
   c/o back and neck pain intermittently.
   Action:
   Prn Dilaudid dosing, warm packs to neck, freq repositioning.
   Response:
   Dilaudid effective, pt much more comfortable, less restless, breathing
   much less labored after dosing.  Turns helpful as well.
   Plan:
   Continue current regimen, advance to longer acting po meds once taking
   po consistently.
